intro: The year 2023 witnessed a dramatic escalation of the conflict, beginning with the Al-Aqsa Flood operation and followed by an unprecedented Israeli military assault on the Gaza Strip. This period has been marked by a severe humanitarian crisis and accusations of genocide.

events.title: Al-Aqsa Flood Operation
events.text: Hamas launched a surprise attack on Israel, leading to a significant escalation of the conflict. This operation was cited by Israel as the reason for its subsequent military offensive on Gaza.

events.title: Gaza Genocide Begins
events.text: Following the Al-Aqsa Flood operation, Israel launched a massive military campaign on the Gaza Strip, resulting in the deaths of over 35,000 Palestinians (as of mid-2024), widespread destruction, and a severe humanitarian crisis. International bodies and human rights organizations have raised concerns about potential war crimes and genocide.

events.title: South Africa files ICJ Genocide Case
events.text: South Africa initiated proceedings against Israel at the International Court of Justice (ICJ), accusing Israel of committing genocide against Palestinians in the Gaza Strip.

sources.title: South Africa v. Israel: Application instituting proceedings
